title: Less poverty in Africa, but numbers remain high
text:
Accra - A World Bank study shows that poverty has slightly eased in sub-Saharan Africa in the past 20 years but the population boom means the numbers living in extreme conditions remain stubbornly high.
Almost half of the continent's population (43%) was living below the poverty line in 2012, defined as surviving on less than $1.90 a day.It was 56% in 1990.
Strong economic growth has helped achieve advances in health and education, but the rapid rise in population has led to an increase in the overall number of extreme poor, the study says.
